department_name: Santa Cruz County Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: Santa Cruz County uses a hybrid system with both colored placards (Green/Yellow/Red) based on major violations AND numerical scores from 0-100 calculated by deducting points for violations

GREEN.description: PASS - No more than one major violation observed and corrected during inspection

YELLOW.description: CONDITIONAL PASS - Two or more major violations observed but corrected during inspection

RED.description: CLOSURE - Facility closed due to imminent threat to health and safety

inspection_details.frequency: Two to four times per year depending on the type of facility
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Yellow placards may trigger reinspection within 3 business days to ensure major violations remain permanently corrected
inspection_details.public_disclosure: All inspection results and scores are publicly available online through the County's inspection database and mobile app

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Santa Cruz County Fire Department and independent Fire Districts
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Hood suppression systems for commercial kitchens require separate fire department permits and inspections per California Fire Code and local amendments
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual inspections required for kitchen hood fire suppression systems per NFPA 96 standards, conducted by Fire Department or licensed fire protection companies

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (Part 7 of Division 104 of California Health and Safety Code)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County Environmental Health Division conducts inspections under state authority
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Santa Cruz County Code Chapter 7.04 governs food facilities with local amendments for nonprofit food facilities at occasional events

confidence_notes: Information verified from official Santa Cruz County Environmental Health website, county code documents, and inspection database. Scoring system clearly documented with specific point deductions: Major violations (8 points), Moderate violations (3 points), Minor violations (2 points) deducted from perfect score of 100.
verification_notes: All key information confirmed through official county sources. Fire safety requirements verified through County Fire Code. Placard system and scoring methodology clearly defined in official documentation.
